meaning_cn: 国民，臣民；可能受影响的；使臣服
definition: 1. a person who has the right to belong to a particular country, especially one with a king or queen; 2. likely to be affected by sth, especially sth bad; 3. to bring a country or group of people under your control, especially by using force
example: Flights are subject to delay because of the fog.

definition: to say what is going to happen in the future
example: He was a 16th-century prophet who foretold how the world would end.

definition: the largest part or most of something
example: Reputable charities spend the lion's share of donations on aid and a tiny fraction on administration.

definition: to delay or stop the progress of something
example: Work on the building was impeded by severe weather.

meaning_cn: 精炼的，提纯的；有礼貌的，优雅的，有教养的
definition: (of a substance) made pure by having other substances taken out of it; polite, well educated and able to judge the quality of things; having the sort of manners that are considered typical of a high social class
example: The hotel lobby reflects the refined taste of the owners.

definition: an artificial slope made of earth and/or stones
example: There is a river/road/railway embankment.

definition: the process of getting rid of large amounts of rubbish by burying it, or a place where rubbish is buried
example: 90 percent of American rubbish is dumped in landfill sites.

definition: to use a needle and thread to repair, join, or decorate pieces of cloth
example: Her wedding dress was stitched by hand.

definition: broken or torn pieces of something larger
example: Debris from the aircraft was scattered over a large area.

definition: a small remaining quantity of something
example: Even today remnants of this practice remain.

definition: to throw or drop things in different directions so that they cover an area of ground
example: Scatter the lawn with grass seed.

meaning_cn: （两地、两物、两种状态等）之间的，中间的
definition: located between two places, things, states, etc.
example: Liquid crystals are considered to be intermediate between liquid and solid.

definition: the impetus and driving force gained by the development of a process or course of events
example: The play loses momentum by its halfway stage.

definition: a countless or extremely great number
example: Myriads of insects danced around the light above my head.

meaning_cn: 着手，开始从事（尤指重要或费力的事）
definition: begin (a course of action, especially one which is important or demanding)
example: He embarked on a new career.

definition: a set of instructions telling you how to prepare and cook food, including a list of what food is needed for this
example: Baking a cake isn't difficult — it's just a matter of following the recipe.

meaning_cn: 包含，包括（尤指很多不同事物）
definition: include different types of things
example: The festival is to encompass everything from music, theatre, and ballet to literature, cinema, and the visual arts.

meaning_cn: 经历，经受（令人不快的事或变化）
definition: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change
example: She underwent an operation on a tumour in her left lung last year.

definition: to become part of a group, country, society, etc., or to make someone or something become part of a group, country, society, etc.
example: You shouldn't expect immigrants to assimilate into an alien culture immediately.

meaning_cn: 奇怪的，神秘的，难以解释的
definition: strange or mysterious; difficult or impossible to explain
example: He has an uncanny ability to guess what you're thinking.

meaning_cn: 假设，设想；把某事建立在（某个前设）上
definition: 1. to suggest something as a basic fact or principle from which a further idea is formed or developed; 2. base something on the truth of (a particular assumption)
example: If we posit that wage rises cause inflation, it follows that we should try to minimize them.

definition: something or someone that annoys you or causes trouble for you
example: I've forgotten my umbrella - what a nuisance!

definition: extremely tired
example: I've been working all night and I'm worn out.

definition: a likely mistake or problem in a situation
example: The store fell into one of the major pitfalls of small business, borrowing from suppliers by paying bills late.

definition: to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving
example: The recent pattern of weather deviates from the norm for this time of year.

definition: relating to the enjoyment or study of beauty
example: The new building has little aesthetic value/appeal.

definition: the fact of an event happening, an invention being made, or a person arriving
example: Life was transformed by the advent of the steam engine.

definition: to grow or develop successfully
example: Rimbaud's poetic genius bloomed early.

definition: able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities
example: He was versatile enough to play on either wing.

definition: to hate someone or something
example: From an early age the brothers have loathed each other.

definition: a person who speaks publicly in support of a particular idea or plan of action
example: He is one of the leading proponents of capital punishment.

definition: If you align yourself with an organization or person, you agree with and support their aims.
example: The major unions are aligned with the government on this issue.

meaning_cn: （使）感到不快的，刺激（神经等）的
definition: a jarring sight, sound, or experience is so different or unexpected that it has a strong and unpleasant effect on something or someone
example: That was a jarring experience.

definition: to take a long time to leave or disappear
example: After the play had finished, we lingered for a while in the bar hoping to catch sight of the actors.

definition: to start or develop as the result of something
example: Their disagreement stemmed from a misunderstanding.

definition: difficult, needing a lot of effort and energy
example: In those days, long-distance travel was slow and arduous.

definition: to give something a particular feeling, quality, or taste
example: Preservatives can impart colour and flavour to a product.

definition: a painting that is painted on a wall, either inside or outside a building
example: We found a mural 72 feet long and 7 feet tall there.

meaning_cn: 向……倾诉，向……吐露情感（或秘密）
definition: to tell something secret or personal to someone who you trust not to tell anyone else
example: She's nice, but I don't feel I can confide in her.

meaning_cn: 除（尤指令人不快之事）之外（还）
definition: in addition to something, especially something unpleasant
example: We missed our flight, and on top of that we had to wait seven hours for the next one.

definition: to balance one influence against an opposing influence, so that there is no great difference as a result
example: The extra cost of travelling to work is offset by the lower price of houses here.

meaning_cn: 不自觉地把自己的欲念等加诸他人；推断；凸出物
definition: 1. the unconscious transfer of one's own desires or emotions to another person; 2. an estimate or a statement of what figures, amounts, or events will be in the future; 3. something that sticks out from a surface
example: Sales have exceeded our projections.

meaning_cn: 难以抵挡的，无法抗拒的
definition: difficult to fight against
example: She felt an overwhelming urge to tell someone about what had happened.

meaning_cn: 装饰华丽的，装饰繁复的
definition: having a lot of complicated decoration
example: The luxurious dress, ornate chair and intimate setting reflect the rococo spirit of the period.
